translations.title: Rachel's Page
translations.name: Rachel Tay
translations.intro1: I'm a Software Developer from Singapore, currently based in Seoul, South Korea.
translations.intro2: Since graduating from the National University of Singapore's School of Computing in 2011, I've worked 4 years in Singapore ðŸ‡¸ðŸ‡¬ - developing Facebook games, mobile apps for both Android and iOS, and educational Flash games; and 6 years in Seoul ðŸ‡°ðŸ‡· - developing Unity mobile games on both Client and Server side.
translations.intro3: This site was created for the purpose of having some fun with web programming while learning to use Angular.
translations.reason_title: 3 reasons why I choose to live in South Korea
translations.reason_intro: Whenever I get on the topic of how long I've lived in Korea (7 years), people are always curious as to why I decided to leave Singapore. "Isn't Singapore better?" Well, here are some of my reasons.
translations.reason1: Weather - it's hot and humid all year round in Singapore, basically 4 seasons of summer. Even though I dislike the extremes of both summer and winter here, I think I dislike sweating more than freezing. Also, having the cooling and beautiful spring and autumn seasons is just the cherry on top.
translations.reason2: Hallyu wave - I love the language (thank you King Sejong for inventing Hangeul), k-dramas, kpop, even down to the palli palli culture.
translations.reason3: Convenience - Abundance of convenience stores, cheap and fast food and package delivery services,  well-established public transport that are on time, and so much more.
